results.title: Colour today
results.brief_description: An account of the properties of colors and their use in decoration, advertising and other spheres of everyday life. Functional use of color in office, factory, and domestic equipment is discussed, and sequences show how color and design combined bring attractiveness to manufactured goods including bicycles, sewing machines and typewriters.

results.title: Colour in clay
results.brief_description: About pottery making in England. Shows the different methods used to form the pieces and ways in which they are decorated at a pottery works in England. Photographer: Jack Cardiff

constellations_other.description: A focus on distinctive and innovative examples of pattern, colour and movement.

results.description: Part of the Goodnight Kiwi series of direct addresses to the viewer specifically designed to be broadcast between the hours of 2-4am. Reflecting the often solitary and ritual nature of technological occupation, Goodnight Kiwi variously offers aesthetic transformation, mass media critique or moments of personal reflection arising from the effects of exhausted wakefulness.
description_for_label: Part of the Goodnight Kiwi series of direct addresses to the viewer specifically designed to be broadcast between the hours of 2-4am. Reflecting the often solitary and ritual nature of technological occupation, Goodnight Kiwi variously offers aesthetic transformation, mass media critique or moments of personal reflection arising from the effects of exhausted wakefulness.

results.title: Colour and the camera
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Pioneers of photography”.
The theory of three colour photography had been known since the beginning of art but early methods were clumsy. Louis Lumiere devised a process in the late 1890’s which was not marketable and it was not until his autochromes became available in 1907 that colour photography was possible for everyone.

results.title: Colour
results.brief_description: A discussion of the nature of color in simple terms. Painting and dying are then shown as a way of preparing surfaces so as to reflect certain colors. Narrated by Joseph McLeod.

results.title: Colour
results.creator_credit: Nico Crama, Color Film Center and Christa van Santen
results.brief_description: Explores the use of colour in art and nature; discusses the concept of colour as the reflection and absorption of white light; explains the significance of hue, value, chroma, and complementary colours; and examines the illusions, emotional impact, and optical effects of colour. Animation: Ronald Raaijmakers. Commentary: Mart Ambry.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Nico Crama, Color Film Center and Christa van Santen

results.title: Colored Nabeshima ware
results.brief_description: The early Japanese learned from the Koreans how to fire and glaze white ceramics, and the art of color glazing from the Chinese. Introduction of these advanced techniques from the Asian continent helped the Japanese to develop their own methods and styles in ceramic art, including those of the uniquely Japanese vessels, the colored Nabeshima ware.
results.description: The early Japanese learned from the Koreans how to fire and glaze white ceramics, and the art of color glazing from the Chinese. results.title: Color speaks
results.creator_credit: Hungarian Documentary Film Studios and Agoshdang Karyani
results.brief_description: The beauties of the landscape, its colorful plant life and the insects and animals which inhabit it: laws of nature and the part color plays in them. Good close up and time lapse photography of insects, plants, birds and animals.

results.title: Color keying in art and living
results.brief_description: An analysis of color relationships. Considers the following: nature of light rays, the spectrum and primary colors; secondary colors and pigment primaries; light reflection by pigments; color keying; complimentary colors; the color wheel; how complimentary colors intensify one another; how color may be used to “echo” itself.

results.title: Color in nature
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Konstantin Grigoriev
results.brief_description: Explores the function of coloration in both plants and animals using nature footage and close-up photography. Examines how color can benefit living organisms in their environment; shows how pigments can cause different colors; identifies the pigment chlorophyll as an essential element in the process of photosynthesis. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.
